intro: Triumfetta katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid conditions. The species is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties are not extensively studied.
